text: The voice belongs to DR. HARRY MCGURK. In CLOSE UP, he st into the camera, now repeating a DIFFERENT SYLLABLE.
---Fa... Fa... Fa... Fa... Fa... Offscreen, a FRIENDLY VOICE addresses the audience.
Close your eyes. (beat) Close them.
You hear “Da”. Now open them.
You hear “Fa”. Close your eyes, it’s “Da”. Open them, it’s “Fa”. Weird, isn’t it? (NOTE: This is a real neurological illusion. The McGurk Effect. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G-1N8vWm3m0 )
Let’s try it a different way. The SCREEN SPLITS into identical shots of Dr. McGurk. On LEFT, his mouth forms the word “Da”, on the RIGHT, “Fa”.
Pick a side. I won’t tell you which one. Is he saying Fa or Da? (then) (MORE )
Now look at the other side. What’s he saying now? (NOTE: Whoever looks left will hear ‘Da’ and whoever look right will hear ‘Fa’)

The truth is that the sound hasn’t changed- only the picture. All we're hearing is ‘Da Da Da.’ But when you look to the right, his mouth forms the word ‘Fa.’ And your poor brain, having seen lips form this sound for your entire life is powerless. It tells you to hear ‘fa.’ It discounts reality and gives you what it perceives to be true. (then) So what's the point of all this you ask? It’s this- Reality is not what you see. It’s what you think you see.
AN UPTOWN WOMAN in her late thirties lingers at the windo Liking what she sees, she waves to the MERCHANT inside. H BUZZES her in.
Good afternoon...
Hi. I love that necklace...
The Woman holds up a DIAMOND AND JADE NECKLACE, smiling.
Oh this one’s great too.
Pure Jade. Mid-century, untreated... She puts it on a VELVET TRAY with SEVERAL OTHER ITEMS, tu her attention to the DISPLAY CASE.
What about that one...?
The sautoir? Wonderful... He opens the case and retrieves a SAUTOIR NECKLACE.
Ohh... A light KNOCK at the door and the Merchant BUZZES another CUSTOMER in. The woman holds the sautoir to her neck.
Now this is beautiful. What do you think?
The Merchant can’t help but notice how beautifully the necklace drapes upon her cleavage.
Perfect.

I prefer the one in your coat, Janice. The familiar voice belongs to NICKY SPURGEON (33), dresse a cheap suit worn by undercover cops and rental car agent He sidles up alongside her as his PARTNER- a larger, similarly dressed man- flanks Janice on her other side.
(busted) Oh fuck--
Sorry sir, this woman’s been working the area for about a week. The partner starts REMOVING JEWELRY FROM THE WOMAN’S POCK and putting it on the glass counter. The Merchant is shoc
Look familiar? Yeah- (to Partner) Take her. The partner whisks her off. Nicky grabs the Jade necklace from the velvet tray.
You're an expert- is this real? The Merchant is surprised at what he sees.
That’s not mine.
No. This one is. Nicky picks up the real Jade necklace fished from the wom pocket. He takes command of the room with an authoritativ confident tone.

That’s her scam-- while she’s holding this here, she’s got your focus. More pointedly- her breasts do. Meanwhile, down here, she’s taking a fake out of her pocket and leaving it on the velvet. She asks to see another- and she pockets the real one. The Merchant is aghast.

Even I can tell this is from the Dollar Bin at Target. But all she needs is a sparkly hint of green in your peripheral vision until she’s out the door. TWO MORE PLAINCLOTHES MEN enter with haste. One begins SNAPPING PHOTOS while Nicky looks to the other.
Pat- we've got cameras here, here, here and here. (to Merchant) We're going to need the surveillance drives. Can someone help him with that? Addled, the merchant looks to a SALESWOMAN across the sto
Yes. Anna? He gestures to her and she escorts Pat into the back. Nic keeps up the intensity on the merchant.
Now look at me. (he does) Do I have your attention? (he does) Is this everything she touched? I need you to be absolutely sure. He nods compliantly.
Everything?
Everything. Nicky places a pile of EMPTY EVIDENCE BAGS on the counter

I need you to place any items she touched into these bags. (he complies) One bag per item. Each bag has a number and each of those numbers are on this claim form. Are you paying attention? He SLAPS A SET OF FORMS on the counter.
This is your record. Please make sure the numbers are correct. You will receive two copies- one yellow- one blue. The blue copy-- The man is checking the numbers intently.

Are you paying attention? (nod) The blue copy is your primary copy. I suggest you put it somewhere other than the yellow copy. But only the blue copy can be used to reclaim evidence. Are you paying attention?
Yes.
Are the numbers correct?
Uh-
I thought you were paying attention.
They seem fine, um, yes. He THRUSTS A PEN in the Merchant’s face.
Good. I need you to sign here. Initial here. Here and here. Initial once more. He TEARS OFF a blue copy and SLAPS it on the counter.
Do not lose it. He tears off the yellow copy as Pat re-emerges from the b with a four hard drives in an evidence bag.

Now my partner is coming back to take a statement. It might be helpful if you jot a few things down while your memory’s still fresh. Can you do that? He nods as Nicky gathers up the evidence bags of jewelry.
If you have any questions, this is my card, okay?
Okay.
We’re gonna get this done as soon as possible. Promise. (holds out his hand) Pen.
Huh?
You stole my pen.
Oh! Sorry. The Merchant finds Nicky’s pen in his pocket, hands it ba
Thank you. Nicky heads for the door. The Merchant watches, concerned
Blue copy, right?

(smiles) You were paying attention. Very good. And with a wide smile, Nicky’s gone. The Merchant looks to the business card. It’s BLANK. He turns it over. BLANK. Confused, he picks up the blue form. What he sees concern him: A SMILING CARPET LOGO above a company name- “MISTER STEAMY CARPET CLEANING.” He looks up. The store is EMPTY- every DISPLAY CASE has been cleaned o Anna emerges from the back, not yet aware...
That policeman gave me a blank card. Isn’t that funny? And as the Merchant bolts for the door--
TITLE CARD: “FOCUS”

High above the city in the cool blue gloam of twilight, N takes in the view from the BALCONY. He seems as distant a the lights on the horizon, as he nibbles on a small packa of gummy bears. He CRUMPLES the empty bag and returns to his room.

Nicky waits for the elevator. He notices a MOTHER and her SON approaching from down the hall. He watches them. DING! The doors open. Nicky enters the elevator, presses lobby button. The mother rushes for the elevator.
Coming... Nicky pays no mind and doesn’t register the woman's astonished face as the doors SHUT on her just inches away
Really?! No reaction.
Nicky approaches a comely CONCIERGE. He turns on the char
Hi, how are you tonight?
I'm fine, thanks- how can I help you?
Weren’t you working this morning? You must be exhausted. I hope they’re paying you enough.
Well, no, but thank you for noticing.
I know Elegio is reservation only, but do they still accept walk-ins at the bar?
Yes, but at eight it may not be worth your time...
That’s why I wanted to talk to you. (smile) (MORE )
Could you call them and tell them Chef Julien Bardolejo of Las Losos in Barcelona was hoping they’d save a spot for him at the bar?
(smiles knowingly) I suppose I could give it shot.

You have a wonderful night. He finishes with a wide smile that satisfies her. It quic fades as he heads for the door- passing a group of TOURIS posing for a photo. One of them EXTENDS A CAMERA to him.
Would you mind...? He keeps walking, pretending not to hear.
A high end hotel restaurant with a crowded bar- Nicky sea prominently at the head of it, enjoying a glass of wine a WAITER places a PLATE of finely prepared food before him.
Gracias, sefor. He cuts into his food, takes a bite. ON THE KITCHEN DOOR: A CHEF and SOUS CHEF sneak looks at awaiting a reaction to their food. Nicky reaches for the SALT. The chef is crushed.

Dammit... The sous chef tries to console him as he skulks off. BACK ON NICKY: Looking around the bar, taking in the face the strangers. Eventually, at the far end of the bar-- A beautiful young woman (JESS BARRETT) shoos off the adva of a DRUNKEN STRANGER. We can’t hear, but reading her lip

I'm waiting for someone. He'll be here any minute...  10. Nicky watches the drunk lean in close to her. She looks around trying to ignore the clingy suitor, making brief e contact with Nicky. She SMIRKS at him as she gently PUSHE the drunk away with a laugh. Nicky smiles and returns to his food. He salts it again.
(distant, from kitchen)
This amuses Nicky, until-
Are you a serial killer? CUT WIDE to reveal JESS is standing next to him.
No. Not anymore, at least. She smiles.
Can you be my boyfriend for a minute?
Sure. Waiting for someone?
Not really. No.
Join me for dinner?
Love to. He turns to the bartender to order when she suddenly grab his plate and starts eating.
I was going to-- (then) Never mind. (to Bartender) Uno mas por favor.
This is really good.
It is.  11.
Kinda salty though.
Didn’t notice...
I'm Jess.
Nicky. They share a smile.
Near closing time. The crowd has thinned. Jess and Nicky still at the bar, surrounded by half-empty wine glasses a mostly eaten dessert, clearly enjoying themselves.
What was this one again?
Montrachet.
Montrachet. And this one?
Gevrey Chambertin. Same region, different grape.
Burgundy.
Very good.
Yaaaaay... A mini high five as Jess beams. Even to a guarded man lik Nicky, she’s disarming and sexy without trying.
So confusing. How’d you learn all this?
Mostly by drinking. The more you drink the more you learn...  12.
Well then that makes me the foremost expert on Jaeger Bombs. They laugh. The bartender gently places the BILL before Nicky. The couple mourns it’s arrival.
For the wine. Food is compliments of the Chef. Nicky nods politely and pulls out a huge roll of hundreds
Does this mean it’s over? I still have so much to learn.
I’m afraid so.
Sad. Well thanks for the rescue...
No problem, although I think your nemesis has lost his sting. He motions across the bar where the drunk guy has nodded with his head in his hand.
Can I walk you somewhere?
(pointing upstairs) Actually I’m staying here.
Oh...
So, yes. A look. A beat.

Nicky and Jess kiss passionately as they back up to the b landing on it with her atop him. After a deep, deep kiss Jess sits up with a smoldering lo She starts to remove her top when--  13. SLAM! The door WHIPS OPEN to reveal a HUGE MAN with a GUN
I knew you were here, bitch! Jess flies off of Nicky who sits up quickly.
It’s my husband!
You're married!?
Shut the fuck up!
Jared wait! Jared rushes toward Nicky and SLAM! PINS HIM AGAINST THE HEADBOARD-- holding the gun to his mouth.
I’m gonna fucking kill you!
NO Jared! Let him go!
No fucking way! You’re dead. (gets in his face) Give me one fucking reason I shouldn't do it?! Nicky, strangely calm, thinks a moment.
I'm drawing a blank...
What?
I think you should do it. I mean let's be honest. You’ve been aggrieved. Jared and Jess are stymied.
Don’t mess around with him Nicky- he’s done hard time!  14.
(to Jared) And frankly, if you had any idea what I was planning to do to your wife before you came in, you’d be really aggrieved.
Shut up man!
Dirty stuff. Really dirty stuff. Real Apehouse stuff.
Wait a second- what kind of stuff are we talking about?
Tommy Lee kind of stuff. You should definitely shoot.
Stop fucking around! I’1l do it!
You'd be doing me a huge favor. Seriously- I’ve got a brain tumor the size of a softball. Jared is surprised to hear this.
Please...
(conflicted) Ah shit! You got cancer? He backs away as Jess goes is suddenly defeated.
He’s onto to us. Are you a pro?
Shit. I told you this wasn’t going to work.
Just give us the money.
Or what?  15.
Or he’s gonna shoot you in the neck.
I don’t want to shoot a guy with cancer. Grandma Mikulski had cancer...
He doesn’t have cancer you idiot! (to Nicky) Just give us the money.

You guys really boned this. You’re supposed to wait until she gets my pants off so when you come in I leave them behind when you tell me to run. Then you got the cash and I’m never coming back. Second- whatever you heard- about how it’s not a felony if there’s no bullets in the gun? It’s crap. Deadly weapon, loaded or not. Jared and Jess completely drop their guard.
When did you make us?
When you lifted the drunk guy’s wallet.
What? Bullshit. Nicky reaches into her jacket on the bed, pulls out a man wallet and tosses it to her.
Couldn’t have been more obvious... She catches it, Nicky heads for the door.
It was good lift!
Sure it was... Nicky is gone, turns her frustration on Jared.  16.
Why didn’t you wait!?
How was I supposed to know when you had his pants off!?
How many times did we go over this? I say, “that’s the biggest one I’ve ever seen” and then you come through the door.
I did hear it! But now I’m thinking it came from across the hall. What are the chances!?
I should have never asked you to do this!
Are you mad at me?
Yeah.
Can I still be your trainer? Jess cools slightly.
(deep exhale) Yeah...
Are you still gonna come to my Zamba class?
...Yeah.
Nicky makes his way through the chilly night back to his hotel. He’s seems pretty unfazed by the goings on.
That was not a shitty lift! He stops, turns- Jess a few yards behind him and approach  17.
The drummer from Def Leopard could take the poke off a drunk. You think that makes you special?
No. This does. She pulls out a DIFFERENT WALLET. Nicky pauses. He pats h breast pocket, it’s his. He’s impressed.
A romantic open air CAFE atop THE HIGH LINE. Nicky and Je have coffee at a cozy table. Nicky is mid story.

..-my Grandfather used to pay Union Pacific twenty grand a year to let him run a game on their trains. Not to the conductor- the owner himself. Cash in hand. Never had a problem, until one day the game got held up by a team out of Toledo. But one of the players had a little derringer- thinks its a good time to defend himself- whips it out- misses. Other guys start firing. Grandpa catches a bullet in the eye. Shouldn’t have happened. (then) Know who knocked over the game? My dad.
No. Did he know?

Of course. He raised my dad in it just like my dad raised me in it. You see an angle- you play it. He didn’t mean for it to go down that way- thought he’d impress him later by splitting up the money with him. At least that’s what I was raised to believe. (then) He was only eighteen years old...
Jesus.  18.
You do this long enough, you see everyone as a player or as someone to be played. It’s no life.
What’s your thing? Inside? Roper?
Everything- been in it so long. Short grift, Big Store. Work the whiz all over too. Cannon...
That’s what I want to do.
No you don’t.
I want to learn it all. I want you to show me.
Look-

No- I wasn’t born into this like you. I was a dyslexic foster kid- no prospects, no future. It’s a minor miracle I’m not a hooker right now. I was lucky enough to have a boyfriend to show me how to lift and I’ve done okay. I know I have a lot to learn but its not like mentors are falling off trees. You’re my shot.

You want advice? Here- Stay off the grift and stay away from the whiz mobs. Because once you're in, you're in. Stick to the pockets, work alone. Save your money and one day you get out and start a business or something. Maybe you fall in love or just have a life.
I can pay you. Just teach me.
I don’t do that.  19. A WAITER leans in and places the CHECK between them. Nick reaches for it, Jess stops him.
I got this. The waiter EXITS, revealing Jess has PULLED THE WALLET FR THE WAITER’S POCKET WITH HER OTHER HAND.
I’m good. You know I’m good. She pulls out some cash. Nicky smiles.
Not the point. Besides- I’m leaving town tomorrow.
Where are you going?
Detroit.
Now you're being a dick. No one goes to Detroit.
None of your business.
At least teach me something.
I gotta go.
Just one thing? Can you show me just one thing? Something new I could use? Anything? Pleeease? (off Nicky’s look) I bought you coffee... Nicky SIGHS.
Nicky demonstrates for Jess. His COAT hangs on a sign and uses his wallet in the front lapel pocket as an example.  20.

I’1ll teach you how to do a few touches but that’s it. I’1l assume you can flip a leather on it’s feet, throw it over if you need to- and pull... Quickly and smoothly he positions the wallet without movi the coat and eventually pulls it out. Something to see. H tosses it in another pocket.
Breast pocket is harder but we know you've got that down- at least if the guy’s had 6 MacCallans...
Ha ha...
Sneaky is fine, but you can get away with much more when you have their attention. He turns to her, taking control.
Look him in the eye. Shake his hand maybe- He gives her a shake. Once he lets go, he raises his othe hand to show her a PAIR OF GLASSES.
Did you feel that?
(smirk) No.
How about this? He holds up her WATCH. She’s shocked.
You took that right off my wrist!
It’s about distraction. It’s about focus. The brain is slow and it can’t multitask. You touch him here- do what you want here-  21. Nicky holds up a MEMBERSHIP CARD.
You take Zumba?
That’s not mine. He continues with incredible agility and speed.

Tap him here, take from here. Look over there, he follows. Take from here... He’s showing her things from her pockets without her even realizing his other hand is pulling out OTHER THINGS. It’ slick, flirtatious ballet and she’s in the middle of it.
What’s on your head? Her GLASSES are now on her head. She smirks. How could sh not feel that?
Are you gonna slap me?
Why?

If you knew where my hand was you'd want to. She looks down, but it’s too late- he’s already pulled he iPhone out of her back pocket. The show continues, becoming ever more seductive, until s can’t take it anymore.

Okay okay okay... I get it. Nicky takes a moment. He steps in close, stares in her ey He gently raises her hand into frame... ...and PLACES HER OWN RING BACK ON HER FINGER. She’s wett than a submarine with screen doors.
Now you've got something to practice...  22. He walks away, leaving her gobsmacked on the green expans the 23rd Street Lawn. FADE OUT.
Nicky and an older man, HORST, wander through a well worn empty house- peeking in room after room in relative silen
Why do I like this place?
No neighbors for one. Foreclosures all around it. I tied ‘em all up with offers just in case somebody decides to buy a house down here again. (Nicky nods) Follow me.
PALM TREES and SUN tell us we’re not in New York anymore. Nicky and Horst emerge from the pastel 1920's bungalow to large yard with and empty pool and look at a UTILITY POLE
Sub-junction. We can tie in to multiple lines so we can diffuse our footprint and keep hopping DNS addresses. FIOS too... Nicky nods again.
How many bathrooms? Fat Ass Farhad is flying in so--
Two and a half. He still got IBS?
Yeah.
He should do a cleanse.
He’s a 500 pound Persian, Horst- he’s not gonna do a cleanse. (MORE )
Give him the half-bath. I don’t want to hear it from Manny and Bob.
We'll be up and running by morning. Where you been staying? Hyatt again?
I like the brunch. You should come by.
No brunch. I’m doing a cleanse. Nicky tunes him out.

Various shots of Nicky driving Miami causeways and street EXT. DOG TRACK —- HOLLYWOOD FLORIDA - SUNSET GREYHOUNDS lit by late afternoon sun run the track as the crowd CHEERS. IN THE STANDS, Nicky takes in the last race with a beer. table before him is littered with CRUMPLED RACE TICKETS. somber face denotes concern. And as the ANNOUNCER calls the end of the race, Nicky CRUMPLES up yet another ticket and sighs. INT. MIAMI BEACH HYATT HOTEL —- DAY A crowded dining area by the pool, populated by FOOTBALL FANS. Alone at a table, Nicky reads a PAPER and sips COFF
Will you be ordering from the menu this morning or using the buffet?
(not looking up) Buffet.
I think you’1l find the pancakes are the best in all of Detroit. He looks up. It’s Jess, proud of herself.  24.
Impressive.
May I? He nods and she sits.
Hyatt rewards card in my wallet?
Yep.
But why Miami?
It’s Super Bowl week. It’s sucker central. Even I know that. They take in the surrounding PATRONS, dressed in football jerseys and drinking heavily.
Mardi Gras for every lifter and grifter in North America.
How many Hyatts did you try?
All seven... three times each.
Sounds boring.
Not so bad. Gave me time to practice. She turns over her purse- 24 WATCHES pour out onto the ta
Thanks for showing me that. (then) Now I want in.
Maybe I’m just here to see the game.  He smiles. 25.

Everyone knows who ran the game on the Union Pacific. You're Nicky Spurgeon. Your grandfather was The Limehouse Kid. Your father is Bucky Spurgeon who’s like the best insideman that’s ever been. I know you're doing something big down here. I just want in.
I’m all crewed up.

Oh come on. (he shrugs) Look- Can we skip the part where I speak with thinly veiled allure? Where I lead you to believe there’s gonna be some earth shattering hump in the works? Please spare me that because I suck at that kind of stuff. I just want in.
No thinly veiled allure?
Nope.
No baby voice? No lingering eye contact? No lippy mouthing of your straw?
I’m hopeless.
A hand grazing my knee?
Nope.
But I love that stuff.
Sorry.  26.
You really should learn. It’s a useful tool, professionally. She purses her lips and cocks her shoulders.
(baby voice) Well maybe you can teach me... in your room... She sips from Nicky’s orange juice straw. He is appalled.
Oh my God... that’s terrible.
I know! See?
We should go. Nicky gets up. Jess is excited.
Am I in?
We should go. She follows him, beaming.
CAMERA MOVES THROUGH a bar packed with fans of the opposi teams as they drink and revel.

Every minute there’s something going on down here. Every bar, restaurant, hotel, wherever... SHOT CONTINUES as a BEARDED MAN bumps into a FAN, quickly apologizing. TILT DOWN as HE TAKES THE FAN’S WALLET.

Guys working alone, working in teams. Not just cash either. Identity theft is a big thing too.  27. ON THE WALLET as the thief PULLS OUT a CREDIT CARD and HA IT ANOTHER THIEF who SWIPES it on a HANDHELD CARD READER.

You can skim the data off a credit card in about a second... The credit card is returned to the wallet, passed off aga and within seconds-- the WALLET IS BACK IN THE FAN’S BACK POCKET and he is none the wiser.

.--and by the time the mark gets wise, he’s back in Youngstown arguing with his wife over the card statement. SHOT CONTINUES to REVEAL NICKY AND JESS at the bar- surrounded by a GANG of ROWDY GUYS. Nicky is mid-bet with one of them, a BALD GUY. Nicky refers to two SHOT GLASSES before him. ONE filled t the brim with BOURBON, the other with WATER.
I’1l make the bourbon and the water switch glasses without pouring them into anything, including my mouth-

No way. But hell- Fifty bucks? Why the fuck not? The other men start waving money around, wanting a piece the action. Jess COLLECTS it as: Nicky grabs a COASTER, PUTS IT ON THE WATER FILLED SHOT G turns it UPSIDE DOWN and puts it ON THE BOURBON GLASS. He PULLS THE COASTER OUT SLIGHTLY to open up a little spa between the glasses and they all watch as PHYSICS TAKES O

head_text.subj: THE HEAVIER WATER FLOWS DOWN INTO THE BOURBON GLASS AND T

text: LIGHTER BOURBON FLOATS UP INTO THE WATER GLASS. The men explode in delighted disbelief.
OOOH! No way! Awesome! Etc...
(checks his watch) It’s been fun guys... Smiling Nicky GRABS THE MONEY and they EXIT.  28.
MONTAGE CONTINUES as Jess and Nicky emerge from a cab.

There’s a flight landing every two minutes at Miami International. Average of 200 passengers per flight. Whoevers not here for the game is here for the party- every one of them looking to drink big, bet big, cheat on their spouse-- and it all costs money... And as they enter the--
A busy lobby. PEOPLE mill about, OTHERS are lined up at t registration desk with their luggage.
(checking his watch) There’s boost teams at all the major hotels. They hit quick and get out before anyone knows what happened... Nicky suddenly stops short and YELLS at Jess.
IF YOU THINK I’M GONNA LET YOUR

head_text.subj: MOTHER TALK TO ME THAT WAY YOU'RE

text: THE ENTIRE LOBBY TURNS. Jess stands there perplexed and r to hit him. But as Nicky keeps YELLING-- QUICK CUTS all around the LOBBY as THIEVES DISGUISED AS TOURISTS take advantage of the situation with amazing spe BY A GIFT SHOP: A passing thief SWAPS OUT a GUCCI SHOPPIN BAG at the feet of a rich woman, stealing hers. ON THE REGISTRATION LINE: A “GUEST” places a FALSE BOTTOM SUITCASE over someone else’s SMALLER SUITCASE and calmly walks away with it inside. All around, SWAPS AND LIFTS play out within seconds to ot unsuspecting people. BACK TO NICKY and JESS. Nicky is suddenly contrite:  29.
Sorry sweetie, me and my temper... He hugs her. She’s mystified.
What the hell was that?
Don’t worry about it. They resume their walk across the lobby.
Did I miss something...?
CONTINUE MONTAGE as a group of HUSTLERS and CARD SHARPS h out in a room. It’s a cheater’s gymnasium-- some practice double deals, others shuffle cards with staggering dexter

There’s card games everywhere and they let anyone with enough cash in. Chances are at least one of those guys you don’t know is a mechanic who can work a deck like Jascha Heifetz doing Tedesco... A CARD MECHANIC shaves down the side of a card deck with sandpaper. A HUSTLER passes out STACKS OF CASH to the oth
Guys will shave down the entire deck except for the aces so they can feel them when they shuffle and pull them out when they need them. ANOTHER CARD SHARP puts in a CONTACT LENS.
Some guys use marked cards you can only see with polarized contacts and glasses...
A PLAYER across from him holds a FIVE CARD HAND. The valu his cards are CLEARLY MARKED IN RED on the backs.  30.
Trips... CUT TO REVEAL WE’RE AT-—

A HIGH STAKES GAME at a raucous high end party in a penthouse. A huge pile of chips and cash is in play. The Card Sharp is opposite the PLAYER, shaking his head i disbelief as he lays down FOUR OF A KIND.
Whoa! Shit! Etc...

I swear, I’ve never had a four of a kind before! The Player as well as TOBEY MAGUIRE and LEBRON JAMES suff huge loss as the “surprised” Card Sharp rakes in the chip MONTAGE CONTINUES as CAMERA DRIFTS from the table to REVE that Nicky and Jess are watching nearby.
Come with me... CAMERA CONTINUES past them, THROUGH THE WALL to reveal--
A MARK and BUXOM WOMAN are about to fornicate when- SLAM! The door to the room is kicked open by a BIG BRUISER.
It’s my husband! As they scramble--
I’m gonna kill you!
(to woman) Give me my pants!

No! Just run!  31. CAMERA FOLLOWS the pants-less mark as he dodges the Bruis and runs out the door and into the HALL-- PASSING JESS AN NICKY from the opposite direction. Nicky looks to Jess-- clearly inferring that that is how it’s done.

Married guys are the best- who are they gonna tell? A second woman SCREAMS from ANOTHER ROOM. WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) That’s my husband! ANOTHER PANTSLESS MARK bursts out of a different room, running for the elevator as Jess and Nicky round the corn END MONTAGE as we CUT TO-- INT. NICKY’S CAR - NIGHT CLOSE ON NICKY, driving. CLOSE ON JESS next to him. Looki uneasy, she shoots an occasional GLANCE over her shoulder CUT WIDE to reveal FAT ASS FARHAD, the 500 pound Persian is filling up the back seat and scowling at Jess.
Who's she?
That’s Jess, Farhad. She’s our intern.
Oh... A long silence, then--
You hittin’ that?
(furls her brow) I’m right here.
No.
She's feisty.  Beat. 32.
Yeah...
You should hit that.
Hello? I’m still right here.
(pointing ahead) Next block. Take a left.
Okay.
I'd totally hit that.
Is this a hazing thing? Like making a frat boy blow a goat? (then) Now that I say that I guess I shouldn't complain...
She talks a lot...
